Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk lemon
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: sqlite bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated sqlite packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. SQLite is a C library that implements an SQL database engine. A large subset of SQL92 is supported. A complete database is stored in a single file and an API is available for management.
The crash-trace-command packages have been updated to ensure correct operation on the Power little endian 64-bit architecture. (BZ#1123995)
This update fixes the following bug:
* Due to the way the memory was allocated by sqlite on architectures with memory page sizes greater than 32KB, the process would crash or produce false results. This was fixed and memory is now managed in a way that takes into account the architecture's memory page size. As a result, the sqlite process now handles memory management consistently across all architectures. (BZ#1118151)
Users of sqlite are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
